website_summaries.verdict: More of a novelty item that's a fun addition to other Rubik's Cube models; if you're looking for a smooth-moving cube, this isn't it.
pros: A different twist by the original Rubik's Cube brand that adds new challenges to the puzzle with a center hole
Collectors rave about adding the unique toy to their Rubik's collections
cons: Doesn't have the same colors as the original cube, which bothers some consumers
Mechanism is stiff and difficult to turn

customer_reviews.title: Basically a 3x3
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd challenge my cube obsessed son with something different, but he solved it in just a matter of minutes once he got oriented. He said it's a basic 3x3. He said it's very nice to look at and a beautiful addition to his collection, but not a challenge to the experienced. Fail on my part, but he still appreciated my effort. If you want a challenge, pass this one by. If you want a nice shelf decoration or addition to your collection, this is a good one to have.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Dragon Lady

customer_reviews.title: another great addition for cubers
customer_reviews.text: the mechanism starts off rather stiff due to the lack of the normal center pieces that held everything together. a little bit of silicone spray and some work-in turns got this spinning smooth and clean in just a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jie

customer_reviews.title: Void challenge cube!
customer_reviews.text: Very challenging even for the adults around here. Void puzzle offers the joy of a Rubik cube with added challenge. Still entertaining several weeks later to everyone that picks it up.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: My son likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Void cubes do not turn well since they don't have a core. Too much friction. Pinches your fingers if you turn to quickly. The stickers seem to peel off but it hasn't been a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Rubics is always so tough to move.
customer_reviews.text: I love cubes and have many of them, but this is so hard to turn, I cant solve it. I’ve been doing cubes for so long its muscle memory. So because its so hard to turn and I don't remember the algorithms, I can’t solve.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this cube!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. He is a Rubks fan and loves getting different cubes. This is one of his faves.
customer_reviews.author: Tampaslp

customer_reviews.title: Great Cube.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a different “spin” on the Rubik’s cube. It does make it slightly more challenging but removing the center piece.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Matheny

customer_reviews.title: Neato
customer_reviews.text: The puzzle was so intriguing I had to purchase for my xollextion. I love the challenge and uniqueness.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Challenging even for cube masters
customer_reviews.text: My adult son has been a Rubik’s cube enthusiast since his teens. He owns almost every size and shape, and I thought this would be fun to add to his collection. He reported the hole added a new level of difficulty and it was challenging to solve. He really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Troy & Nicole

customer_reviews.title: GLUE CUBE
customer_reviews.text: I think someone glued it before packaging. I know you have to work with new cubes for a bit, but this one is ridiculous. One side would turn with moderate effort after unboxing, but every other side I felt I was going to break it. Will not be buying any more cubes from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just like solving 3x3 but corners don't match each time.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: A new challenge!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! While similar to the traditional Rubik cube, the “void” on each side makes it far more challenging. It’s not impossible but more difficult and takes more time to solve.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel1285

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and different
customer_reviews.text: My son who is 10 loves this thing. That is all he wanted for Christmas for the most part. He thinks it is totally awesome, even still now, 2 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice twist on the normal cube. My son thinks it's a little harder, but enjoyed the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nope nope nope
customer_reviews.text: The idea is nice, but it's extremely hard to turn. It can easily take 10 seconds to turn a face: it gets stuck, and sometimes even lots of jiggling doesn't help and you're better off turning it 270 degrees the other way. If you've never solved the normal rubik's cube, just get one of those (something with "speed cube" in description, not the original one; also start with 2x2x2), it's not much different but waaay more enjoyable to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Fun to play and exercises your brain at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Ja9yu

customer_reviews.title: Cool appearance and feel.
customer_reviews.text: Just a hair trickier than the regular cube because there is no center color to refer to, but it looks and feels so cool! For an experienced or older child durability is not an issue, but I have a feeling it won't last long if young kids try to crank it the wrong way. A great cube for the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Red Pepper

customer_reviews.title: I fell cheated, very bad cube
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend not buying this cube, is really really bad and is too expensive for its quality. I feel cheated, I paid $ 14 by a cube that not turn.

customer_reviews.text: Doesn't turn very smooth out of the box. The puzzle itself is good but the action is hard. It sticks a lot.

I would have rated it higher, but the color scheme was not to my liking. I would like to see this cube in the normal, red, blue, white, orange, yellow and green.

customer_reviews.title: Same old fun with some new tricks
customer_reviews.text: Solves just like a standard 3x3, except a little bit faster since you don't have the middle pieces. Also has some parity errors mixed in so requires use of new algorithms unless you prearrange the colors just right. Fun watching someone that's used to blazing through a 3x3 get stuck on this one.

customer_reviews.title: Interesting, But Not Smooth
customer_reviews.text: This requires much more careful alignment when twisting this cube; and as impatient as I am, I end up fighting it quite a bit. This novel design was just never going to be as smooth as a normal cube. I do keep messing with it though. Maybe I'm a masochist, but I have this idea it'll improve my technique. Hah! Otherwise, this cube adds one additional logic challenge over the standard 3x3x3 cube, and I'm still tinkering with that, as well.

customer_reviews.title: Turning ease is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I took this cube out of the packaging and started twisting the faces to get a feel for it. The colors are bright and very nice but the turning of the faces was pitiful. One face barely rotates at all and tries to lock at every pause or every half turn. Overall the cube looks nice, solves like a 3x3x3 rubiks cube, but fails in a key feature for puzzle cubes. I solved it once and will probably not do much else with it. Overall, I'm very disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Interesting.
customer_reviews.text: I only picked this up because I thought it was neat to have a cube without the guts. To my surprise, it is subtly different than the typical Rubik's cube. To solve it consistently, you'll have to pick up one more algorithm to account for the missing center pieces. I'm sure other reviews have commented on the parity differences with the regular cube. Fair warning: This is not for speed cubers. The design is entirely different from a regular cube and it has to be much more closely aligned to be able for it to turn compared to a regular cube. This cube is for Coolness and curiosity purposes only.
customer_reviews.author: Trick Brown

customer_reviews.title: I'm stuck!

It might seem like it isn't that hard since it's like a regular cube, just with imaginary center pieces. But it isn't! The missing center pieces makes it a lot more difficult. It's possible to get stuck and have to rescramble the cube again to be able to solve it haha

The colors are different than a standard cube so you have to think a little, and the hole does add some extra challenge including some potential parities. It is a fun cube, but it is not fast. The mechanism is clunky. This is a puzzle to be savored. No one is going to set any records with this. Still, if you can solve the standard cube, this is a fun puzzle to push your mind a little.

Unfortunately, I still am lousy at solving the cube, so this is a mixed blessing :-) The cube is a little stiff/blocked to turn until you break it in.

product_meta.title: Winning Moves Games The Void Puzzle
product_meta.description:
Try Your Hand at Conquering the Void

The Rubik’s Cube is a classic color-matching puzzle that can be enjoyed at home or on the move. The Void is an evolution of the original 3x3 Rubik’s Cube, designed by Katsuhiko Okamoto. The Void has missing center cubes that make this puzzle harder to solve than the original 3x3 Rubik’s cube.

A must for puzzle lovers, the aim is to try twist and turn the Rubik’s Void to its original state, with every side having one solid color. An incredibly addictive, multi-dimensional challenge that will fascinate puzzle fans as much as the original Rubik’s Cube has done for over three decades.

There are... wait for it... 43,252,003,274,489,856,000 ways of arranging the cubes, and only one of these is the solution. Turn and twist away – can you solve it?

The Rubik’s Void Cube features a mechanism that results in a smoother, faster and more reliable play. The traditional stickers have been replaced with plastic tiles which means no fading, peeling or cheating!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Void is a "hole" new puzzle with a "hole" new challenge-but something's missing? The Void is amazing to see, to touch and to play.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED RUBIK’S CUBE - A combination of mathematics, art and science, the iconic Rubik’s Cube challenges your mind and problem-solving skills. The innovative 3x3 Rubik’s Void is an advanced version of the original official Rubik’s Cube. The Void doesn’t have a center, which makes it even harder to solve this legendary puzzle! A challenging brain teaser toy you can play at home or on the move.

TURN, TWIST & REPEAT - The Rubik’s 3x3 Void Cube features six different colored sides, each made up of nine squares. Once the faces are jumbled up, you need to twist, turn and rotate the Rubik’s Cube until each of the six faces has only one color.

A MUST HAVE FOR PUZZLE LOVERS - The Void Cube is another incredibly addictive, multi-dimensional challenge that will fascinate puzzle fans as much as the Original Rubik’s Cube has done for over three decades. Twist and turn The Void to return the six colored rings to their complete state and you will find this difficult puzzle really is amazing to see, touch and play with.
IMPROVED 3x3 CENTERLESS DESIGN - All the features of the original puzzle cube but with a much more challenging, faster, smoother and reliable play. No more frustrating snagging or popping core.
